< QWidgets++ - The C++ Class Library for the Photon microGUI

Author:   Markus Loffler Start Date: 8/6/98

Module: CContainer.hpp Description: CContainer class for handling PtContainer widgets

Definition at line 15 of file CContainer.hpp.

Member Function Documentation

int CContainer::setLeftAnchoredRelative ( )
 

Interpret the upper-left x component of setAnchorOffsets as 1/100 of a percent. A value of 10000, for example, would equal 1 percent.

int CContainer::setLeftAnchoredLeft ( )
 

Anchor the container's left extent to the left edge of its parent's canvas.

int CContainer::setLeftAnchoredRight ( )
 

Anchor the container's left extent to the right edge of its parent's canvas.

int CContainer::setLeftAnchoringOff ( )
 

Don't anchor the container's left extent

int CContainer::setAnchorOffsets ( int left,
int top,
int right,
int bottom )
 

int CContainer::getAnchorOffsets ( int & left,
int & top,
int & right,
int & bottom )
 

The four values determine the anchor offsets of each of the container's sides. (An anchor offset is the distance between the anchoring side of the parent and corresponding side of the child.) Depending on the anchor flags you specify, the offsets will be either absolute or relative (as 1/100 of a percent).

int CContainer::setFullAnchoring ( )
 

int CContainer::setFullAnchoring ( int left,
int top,
int right,
int bottom )
 

Anchors left to left, right to right, top to top and bottom to bottom The second form of setFullAnchoring automatically sets the anchor offsets as in the function setAnchorOffsets

int CContainer::setAnchoringOff ( )
 

Sets no anchoring at all

int CContainer::setHorizontalAnchoring ( )
 

int CContainer::setHorizontalAnchoring ( int left,
int right )
 

Anchors left to left and right to right The second form of setHorizontalAnchoring automatically sets the anchor offsets as in the function setAnchorOffsets

int CContainer::setVerticalAnchoring ( )
 

int CContainer::setVerticalAnchoring ( int top,
int bottom )
 

Anchors top to top and bottom to bottom The second form of setVerticalAnchoring automatically sets the anchor offsets as in the function setAnchorOffsets

int CContainer::setBalloonsOn ( )
 

int CContainer::setBalloonsOff ( )
 

int CContainer::isBalloons ( )
 

If off, prevents balloons from being inflated in this or any child container.

int CContainer::setHotkeyTerminatorOn ( )
 

int CContainer::setHotkeyTerminatorOff ( )
 

int CContainer::isHotkeyTerminator ( )
 

If on, prevents hotkey search from going to parents of this container. Note that this flag works only if it's set in a disjoint container-class widget.

int CContainer::setFirstProcessAsHotkeyOn ( )
 

int CContainer::setFirstProcessAsHotkeyOff ( )
 

int CContainer::isFirstProcessAsHotkey ( )
 

If on, then key events that reach this container are processed as hotkeys before being passed to any children. If the key is a hotkey, the event is consumed and isn't passed to any children. Normally the key is passed to the children and, if not consumed, is processed as a hotkey.

int CContainer::setBlockCuaFocusOn ( )
 

int CContainer::setBlockCuaFocusOff ( )
 

int CContainer::isBlockCuaFocus ( )
 

If on, prevents CUA from focusing on this container.

int CContainer::setAutoExtentOn ( )
 

int CContainer::setAutoExtentOff ( )
 

int CContainer::isAutoExtent ( )
 

Causes the container to reextent when any of its children are realized, moved, or resized.

int CContainer::setCuaKeysOn ( )
 

int CContainer::setCuaKeysOff ( )
 

int CContainer::isCuaKeys ( )
 

Allows CUA keys to function in this container (and its children).

int CContainer::setCuaArrowsOn ( )
 

int CContainer::setCuaArrowsOff ( )
 

int CContainer::isCuaArrows ( )
 

Allows arrow key navigation in this container (and its children).

void CContainer::addBallonsCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

A callback that the container invokes if the pointer remains motionless for 1.25 seconds over the widget specified in the callback structure.

void CContainer::addFilterCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

Callback list invoked when an event that matches the provided event mask is to be passed to a child of the container (returning Pt_END prevents any child from seeing the event).

void CContainer::addResizeCallback ( PtCallbackF_t callbackFunction,
void * data = 0 )
 

A list of callbacks that this widget invokes when its parent is resized.
